Figure 2. Semantic annotation process 
- 
DBpediaOntology. This class contains classes and properties of the DBpedia 
ontology related to the parameters of each service. This class is related to the 
classes DBpediaInstance and GeonamesInstance by means of the 
relation hasCollection. This relation has a cardinality of 1 in the 
DBpediaOntology end, and 0..* in the DBpediaInstance and 
GeonamesInstance. 
- 
DBpediaInstance. This class collects values from the DBpedia SPARQL 
Endpoint, where a parameter may have one o more associated resources.  
- 
GeonamesInstance. This class collects geospatial information related to 
latitude, longitude, and bounding box parameters from a local GeoNames4 
SPARQL Endpoint. 
 
The information related to each parameter of the RESTful service (semantic 
annotations) is stored only once in the system repository. By doing this, we avoid to 
duplicate information related to the same parameters, storing annotations 
independently of services and increasing the efficiency of our system. 
 
                                                           
4 http://www.geonames.org/
speaker: SYSTEM
